name: The Last Outpost on the Left

system.biography:
A bit beefier than the normal cultist, the leader is wearing armor under his robes. He still, however, has the tell-tale purple mustache. He also is a 1st level caster and knows the 3 level 1 spells below and can cast each once per combat.

  • flame hands

  • phantasmal blade

  • mimic
system.to_the_max_normal: The cultist stabs you in the side dealing an additional [[1D4]] @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.journal.JournalEntry.Ej0fIoR2umnEbLfo.JournalEntryPage.sk1A640XsLbv0SfC]{Bleeding} damage
system.to_the_max_ouch:
BLOOD FOR THE OLD GODS!: Stabs you with a ceremonial Dagger as part of a Summoning spell. The attack deals normal damage but opens a portal in an
open space next to the cultist. An @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.uNeHflrrzIEH4HxO]{Otherworldly Spawn} crawls out and attacks as well.

system.description: The War Wizard’s fingers begin to glow like embers in a fire before shooting out small flames, burning anything flammable the caster touches. Paper or a book will be engulfed in flames. Creatures touched take [[/roll 1D6]] Burning damage. The spell’s duration varies. In its basic form, the spell duration is Instant. By spending a Khaos Point, the caster may extend this duration to a Round, adding additional Rounds of duration for each Khaos Point expended.

The War Wizard can mimic any sound, from crumbling rocks to a wounded goblin. The only limit to the sound is the caster’s imagination. The sound can be heard up to 120 ft away and lasts for a single round.

Channeling pure hatred, the War Wizard conjures up a blade of negative magical energy. The blade’s form is determined @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.yjWloGuZdxPij942]{randomly}.

The War Wizard cannot score a critical hit with this weapon, nor can it fumble. A die result of 20 or 1 still automatically hits or misses, respectively.

system.to_the_max_normal: The claw hits a tender spot dealing an additional [[1D4]] damage
system.to_the_max_ouch: CLAW-SOME! Giant Lobster Claw Cuts your head clean off. Instant death!!

system.description: The creature’s blood is so radioactive that even the touch of it can do harm! If a skumdog comes in contact with the blood they roll on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.HyBQa4FGfKxwNOaw]{Minor Mutations} Table

system.biography: Ugly S.O.B.s! The Mutant Brutes are mean, big nasty, and super bumb. They are perfect for mutant raid patiez and assaulting humanoid sectors.
system.to_the_max_normal: Big Basher hits for an addiotional [[1D4]] damage.
system.to_the_max_ouch: BASH! SMASH! The Big Basher hits for an additional [[1D6]] damage and gains Spillover.

system.biography: Uses the Caster Melee To the MAX! table

system.description: It's a keycard. It's yellow. Probably opens a door or container or something.

system.biography: Weak men in robes who want to usher in another end-times. Every Khaos god or Demi-bro has a cult, good luck keeping up with them all.
system.to_the_max_normal: The cultist stabs you in the side dealing an additional [[1D4]] @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.journal.JournalEntry.GolSNvsGoLOK5zXR.JournalEntryPage.5jpPWVVtjusPhEyZ] damage
system.to_the_max_ouch: Blood for the old gods!: Stabs you with a ceremonial dagger as part of a summoning spell. The attack deals normal damage but opens a portal in an open space next to the cultist. An @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.uNeHflrrzIEH4HxO]{Otherworldly Spawn} crawls out and attacks as well.

system.description: A group of 3+ cultist can rush an opponent ignoring initiative and hitting the target 1st in the melee phase of combat. (They can only perform this one time per encounter.)

system.biography:
A sentient walking and killing crystal pitcher of Drool-Aid brand sugar-tastic drink mix. The Drool-Aid People are summoned to Terra-Realm from their home dimension of Burgerworld. Once summoned through ritual and incantation, the Drool-Aid Man can be enslaved by the caster and made to do their biddings.

When at half of their starting life total the Drool-Aid Man begins to crack and spill toxic liquid. Anyone in melee combat with them takes [[/roll 1D4]] damage anytime their attack is successful. When the Drool-Aid Man dies it shatters and anyone within 10ft makes an [[/save agility]] or be hit by shrapnel and toxic liquid. On a failed save they take [[/roll 2D6]] damage. A 10ft radius where the drool-aid man died becomes caustic and if any creature moves in the radius takes [[/roll 1D6]] damage per 5ft of travel.
system.to_the_max_normal: Punch right to the face knocking out [[1D4]] Teeth, and dealing an additional [[1D6]] damage.
system.to_the_max_ouch: FLAVOR BLAST! The Drool-Aid man vomits his insides on the target dissolving skin and intestines leaving nothing but a skeleton. Instant death.

system.description: When at half of their starting life total the Drool-Aid Man begins to crack and spill toxic liquid. Anyone in melee combat with them takes [[/roll 1D4]] damage anytime their attack is successful.

When the Drool-Aid Man dies it shatters and anyone within 10ft makes an [[/save agility]] or be hit by shrapnel and toxic liquid. On a failed save they take [[/roll 2D6]] damage. A 10ft radius where the Drool-Aid Man died becomes caustic and if any creature moves in the radius takes [[/roll 1D6]] damage per 5ft of travel.

system.biography: Run-of-the-mill average ugly mutie. This one just so happens to be handy with a blaster rifle.
system.to_the_max_normal:
The shot hits the target in the shoulder dealing an additional [[1D4]] damage and forcing them to drop whatever they may be holding in that hand. 50%
Left side.
system.to_the_max_ouch: HEAD SHOT! Target’s brains are splattered all over the closest Party Member. covered in blood and brains must roll on the Fear table.

system.description: All creeps that would be considered a Mutant gain the Mutoid special ability. No two mutants are the same, appearance and abilities vary so greatly among them. Each mutant rolls on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.HyBQa4FGfKxwNOaw]{Minor Mutations} table, unless otherwise stated, or they can forgo and roll on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.wWzmjUlTi9EUMRvR]{Mutant Appearance} table.

system.biography: Mutated cannibal creeps that want to eat your flesh and harvest your teeth. Has either a Ripper OR a Slasher.
system.to_the_max_normal: Hits the target with the hilt in the mouth knocking out [[1D4]] teeth dealing normal damage.
system.to_the_max_ouch:
Mutated Strike slices open the target’s stomach exposing vital organs to the grime of the wastelands. Target goes Prone and death is imminent in [[1D4]]
turns.

system.description: All creeps that would be considered a Mutant gain the Mutoid special ability. No two mutants are the same, appearance and abilities vary so greatly among them. Each mutant rolls on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.HyBQa4FGfKxwNOaw]{Minor Mutations} table, unless otherwise stated, or they can forgo and roll on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.wWzmjUlTi9EUMRvR]{Mutant Appearance} table.

system.biography: Shambling shells that were once Humanoid, these decaying animated corpses roam the wastelands in search of brains to devour. Oftentimes brought back to life by a Nekromancer to become his servants after death.
system.to_the_max_normal: The zombie’s teeth sink in a bit deep dealing an additional [[1D4]] damage.
system.to_the_max_ouch: The bite has a bit of toxic saliva in it. The target must make a [[/save resolve]] or become a Zombie.

system.description: These bastards just won’t die! Destroying the head is the only way, head shots with guns works the best. When attacking a zombie roll a [[/roll 1D6]] in addition to the 1D20 attack roll. A roll of a 6 on the 1D6 is considered a head blow.
An oversized pink pastel plastic egg with “crack in case of an emergency" printed on it. When cracked a nade is prepped and will blow up in 1 turn.
It's a keycard. It's yellow. Probably opens a door or container or something.
A skeleton key extracted from inside the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.Lf1kVxdLWAU9mq1F]{Drool-Aid Man}. Has a strange, blinking eye on the handle. I wonder what it opens…

journal.name: The Last Outpost on the Left

text.content:
Dimly lit, the fresh smell of gore is overwhelming

  • 3 Corpses of Guardsmen litter the floor, they have been disemboweled, and one has had his brain scooped clean out the back

  • Half way up the room is a trip wire attached to a “Death Box” (see below). If triggered the 3 corpses will rise as @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.Jl8B7jbkA0voPPiO]{Zombies}.

NORTH: Two sliding synthetic doors are shut.

SOUTH: Door leading outside

”Death Box” - A devious trap constructed of a smoke grenade laced with reanimation serum, which was made airborne. Any dead flesh within the cloud is brought back to the world of the living for a brief period of time before turning to jet black sludge. ([[/roll 1D6+1]] turns)

The double door entrance are “blast doors”, meaning they can withstand quite a punch from attacks and not open. There is a keypad next to the entrance. Bloody fingerprints can be seen on certain buttons, if a PC notices them they can spend [[/roll 1D6]]-Brains Modifier of turns to decipher the entrance code. If the code-breaking takes longer than 2 turns, the door swooshes open then roll on the @UUID[RollTable.jSb9fvY5cT7HkDgF]{random encounter table}. If the result of the roll is a negative outcome, the PC figures it out instantly.

Pitch black except for the blue light coming from behind the glass wall on the east. The room is outfitted with clunky scanning machines, that the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.0ZTQCHyNCMmiSWdv]{Gunners} are hiding behind.

As the door slides open the, 2 Gunners shoot in the directions of the open door.

  • Nothing Of Note In The Room.

North: Normal Wooden Door. (Unlocked)

East: Glass Wall Where @UUID[.9CrP5vswLqKQ5kiL]{Guard Room} Looks Into Security Checkpoint (this room).

South: Door Leading To The @UUID[.2r0LVd05zWNnMQ7t]{Entrance}

Stinks like rotten pizza and gym socks. Pitch black except for the blue light coming off of the screen of the Data Tape Drive affixed to the northern wall.

  • Data Tape Drive can be checked and discovered this Outpost is hiding a top secret Lab where they are splicing mutant DNA into humanoids.

  • The Tape can be formatted and taken from the drive.

WEST: Glass wall looking into @UUID[.p8O6g64mFMLvqzp8]{Security Checkpoint}.

SOUTH: Door leading to the @UUID[.2r0LVd05zWNnMQ7t]{Entrance}.

Smells musty, but well lit. Dead Bodies litter the cells.

  • 2 Humanoids are locked in the cell furthest from the door on the NORTHERN wall of cells

  • [[/roll 1D4]] @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.IBEke4njGAbl5Vlo]{Mutant Raiders} and 1 @UUID[Actor.9EjNegTz3a54IrzR]{Mutant Brute} are guarding the cell with the Humanoids in it. 

  • The Humanoids are both Guardsmen (@UUID[Actor.HR6GWU1dzXBTJnJ2]{Doug}, @UUID[Actor.f06R5OrHCdCvSGU0]{Cliff}). Doug has the @UUID[Item.93ifydR5IIuy6bjV]{Yellow Keycard} and instructs the party on how to enter the main lab. They can join the party and fight back against the mutant assault.

 WEST: Door leading to the @UUID[.1D9M1fjApmPU5468]{Hall Corridor}

Drab empty dirty white walls. With the exception of the blood trail going up and down each wall. (OPTIONAL: Roll Random Encounter every time they enter the Corridor)

  • @UUID[RollTable.jSb9fvY5cT7HkDgF]{Random Encounter}

  • Bloody foot prints that go everywhere including up the wall and on the ceiling

SOUTH: Locked door needs @UUID[Item.93ifydR5IIuy6bjV]{Yellow Keycard}

The room is dark except for the glow of the “To the Extreme” Vending machine located on the north wall. There are 3 beds and 3 footlockers on each side wall (east and west). You think you would get used to the stench of decay by now, nope. by now, nope.

  • To the Extreme Vending machine is operational

  • 2 of the footlockers contain gold and 1 has a can of @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.n2JzZJAZMyfhFSq1]{Glug-Chug Zero} in it.

NORTH: Door leading to @UUID[.5LtXZp2VwpyhBrFi]{Quarters II}

SOUTH: Door leading to the @UUID[.1D9M1fjApmPU5468]{Hall Corridor}

To the Extreme Vending

The sickly green bright art of a mohawked skeleton being electrocuted as he gulps down a can of “High Octane Freedom Potion.” The fully functional machine has 6 choices a PC can choose from:

  1. @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.nEYF0w3NF4NthHij]{Blastoid Candy Chunks}

  2. @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.n2JzZJAZMyfhFSq1]{Glug-Chug Zero}

  3. 2x@UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.ov70ezqZSg1hHQu0]{Death Sticks}

  4. 1x@UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.HERjzAfL3k3davBz]{Vitality Stick}

  5. @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.lXVH9dy3CfdA96zu]{High Octane Freedom Potion}

  6. @UUID[Item.NCtWNfbyu7knnfBD]{Ultimate Rush}

A cracked @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.lHYWnuDBT14mFBes]{Sta-Bright chem stick} is visible in the North-West corner. You would think you would get use to the stench of decay, nope. Room is filled with beds and foot lockers (6 each) 

  • @UUID[RollTable.jSb9fvY5cT7HkDgF]{Random Encounter}

  • 2 of the foot lockers contain gold and 1 has a can of @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.items.Item.n2JzZJAZMyfhFSq1]{Glug-Chug Zero} in it. 

EAST: Door leading to the @UUID[.1D9M1fjApmPU5468]{Hall Corridor}

SOUTH: Door leading to @UUID[.RHPhsJFM1cfQ1T1j]{Quarters}

The caustic smell of burnt chemicals but a well lit room. The walls are lined with various science machines and gizmos with an operating table in the center. 

  • 2 @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.IBEke4njGAbl5Vlo]{Mutant Raiders} are ransacking the drawers as books and flpapers are flying everywhere 

  • 1 Mutant @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.qQTwUfbEzr2CrC4m]{Cultist} with a chain around his neck being held by one of the raiders is keeping watch on the door. 

  • There is a dead body on an operating table its chest cavity is wide open as flies are buzzing around it. Upon inspection there is a bag hidden deep in the cadaver. Inside the bag are a few baggies of rainbow powder. 

WEST: Door leading to the @UUID[.1D9M1fjApmPU5468]{Hall Corridor}

SOUTH: Door leading to the @UUID[.0WWtklYFfUv1CTUl]{Bio-Flesh Regenerator}

The room is slightly pungent with a hint of black licorice. Dimly Lit, the glow from the Bio Flesh Regenerator’s liquid is visible. 6 man-sized vats sit on the outskirts of the walls, with a central Data Tape Drive in the center of the room. With the data tape inserted one humanoid can enter a tank and fully heal all wounds suffered. After the tape is erased. 

  • Bio-Flesh Regenerator can heal 1 party member 

  • Two of the vats have @UUID[Actor.T46xeMMgOmcUrcvD]{Naked Cyberskins} in them (Reagan 2000 models) If the data tape is removed they will break the glass and fight, naked, and with just their metal fists. 

  • Drinking the liquid in the vats gets a roll on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.BIDFFaLxG6ywrUF8]{Drug Effects} table

The lab smells surprisingly fresh, as opposed to the rest of fithe outpost reeking of filth and mutant stained garments. The main lab is by far the most high-tech room in the entire place. The walls are lined with machines dug up from all over the forgotten world ruins. In the center is a giant man-vat (Double the size of the ones in the @UUID[.0WWtklYFfUv1CTUl]{Bio-Flesh Regenerator} room) The liquid is clear and you can see a man with 2 giant lobster claws for hands. Along with some sort of bio-mechanical structures affixed to his face on his eyes. A lone scientist is still working on a Tape Dock located by the Man-Vat. He will continue to work and pretend the party isn’t there. If he is murdered the man vat opens and the Gene-Slammed Lobster man springs to life ready to waste whoever killed his master. 

If the Scientist is forced away from his Tape Dock he will use the single-shot pistol he is packing (1D6-1, AC 9, 1 HP) 

  • @UUID[Actor.Tn0w1PMXOil2lAsF]{Scientist} rocking a single-shot pistol, keeps working 

  • When @UUID[Actor.hiMBdciWDCN0KgUu]{Gene-Slammed Lobster} man dies his claws are the most succulent lobster meat ever. 

WEST: Door to @UUID[.H3yx27Mu0bSsQzAk]{Hall De-Con Corridor}

The room smells like synthetic purple, the only illumination is the torches held by the cultists who are standing in a circle, next to the south wall. 6 cultists and 1 cult leader are preforming a ritual of some sort. The symbol on the wall begins to glow in a purple-ish light. The ground rumbles a bit as the chanting of “oh yeah, oh yeah, oh yeah.” Gets louder and louder. Until the wall explodes killing some of the cultist as a resounding “OOOOOOOOOOHHHH ThYEAHHHHHHH!” is bellowed out. The Drool-Aid man is standing on the rubble of the wall and the bodies of his followers. 

  • After the Summoning there are 3 @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.qQTwUfbEzr2CrC4m]{Cultists} and the @UUID[Actor.HhN9fvciFV7IyeTB]{Cult Leader}, along with a giant pitcher of drool-aid animated called @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.actors.Actor.Lf1kVxdLWAU9mq1F]{The Drool-Aid Man} (grape variant) 

  • If an attempt is made to drink his purple insides, the drinker must make a [[/save resolve]] or his insides are turned into glittery dust. On a success he rolls on the @UUID[Compendium.neon-lords.tables.RollTable.BIDFFaLxG6ywrUF8] table. 

  • When the fiend is finally slain, and someone searches the dead dude you will find floating around inside of him a @UUID[Item.4yoBYoUCS6PLw3yC] with a blinking eye on the handle. 

  • The Cult leader was carrying a scroll with a random level 1 War Wizard spell on it.

@UUID[Item.93ifydR5IIuy6bjV]{YELLOW KEYCARD} NEEDED TO ENTER! 

As the door hisses and the party is sprayed with a white decontamination spay of some sort a silhouette can be seen in the mist. The spray has a mildew smell to it, very unsanitary stench. 

  • @UUID[Actor.T46xeMMgOmcUrcvD]{Naked Cyberskin} ready to rip out the throats of the party. 

NORTH: Door to @UUID[.1D9M1fjApmPU5468]{Hall Corridor}

EAST: Door to @UUID[.KBoAKOsUsOialGe2]{Main Lab}

SOUTH: Door to @UUID[.MR1Z3zU1KRhm31Uv]{Drool-Aid Summoning Room}

tables.name: Initial Intel
tables.description: A scout team outfitted with a meat scanner, transmitted back to us some vital information before being eviscerated at the hands of who or what has taken over the last outpost.

results.text: The outpost burnt to the ground There are no survivors.
Mutiny! The guards have taken control of the outpost.
They are holding hostages in one of the rooms.
A portal to HELLWORLD has been opened.
The outpost is a front for a secret Lab.
Hidden beneath the outpost is a cache of exotic weapons and fantastical items.
In a foot locker is hidden a can of Glug-Chug.
Part of the Drool-Aid Cult is using the outpost to summon the Drool-Aid man.
Rival War Wizard and [[1D4]] Otherworldly Spawn
2 Mutant Brutes fighting over half of a guardsmen
Naked Cyberskin, naked and has blood-lust in his robot eyes
